text: [Music]
[Applause]
this quirky comedy from director Wes
Anderson was released worldwide on March
7th 2014 wait wait wait a best picture
nominee that was released in the spring
and with a yearhigh total of nine
nominations is such a thing even
possible the $30 million picture also
did very well financially taking home
175 million in ticket sales making it
Anderson's most successful picture yet
the 100 minute story follows the
Misadventures of a legendary concierge
at a prestigious Hotel alongside his
trusted lobby boy the R-rated plot has
dozens of twists turns and surprises
involving murder conspiracy Prison
Breaks art theft and surviving both
world wars Ray findes leads the massive
and hugely talented Supporting Cast
which includes deep breath F Murray
Abraham Matthew alarick Bob Balaban
Adrien Brody William defo Jeff Goblin
Harvey kitel Jude Law Bill Murray Edward
Norton Jason schwarzman Leah Hado Tilda
Swit Tom Wilkinson Owen Wilson and Tony
rori they're all fantastic but it's FS
who turns in the most rising performance
exhibiting comedic timing and
playfulness we've never seen before hard
to believe this is the same guy who
played a hard ass Nazi in Chin's list 20
years ago in exchange for your help your
loyalty and your services as my personal
valot I pledge to you 1.5% of the net
sales price 1.5 plus room and
board could he make it 10 10 you joking
that's more than I'd pay an actual
dealer and you wouldn't know Kiara skuro
from chicken giblets no 1.5 is correct
but I tell you what if I die first first
and I most certainly will you will be my
sole air there's not much in the kitty
except a set of ivory backed hairbrushes
and my library of romantic poetry but
when the time comes these will be yours
along with whatever we haven't already
spent on hes and whiskey this is our
sacred
Bond I'll draw it up right now
Anderson's direction is as always
vibrant and unique adopting different
aspect ratios to delineate three
parallel narratives he also makes ample
use of lock down wide shots that make
quick 90Â° pans around the decorative and
colorful sets the quick wited dialogue
is peppered with vulgar language and
lots of dead pan punch lines making
great use of the tit hotel's large
ornate Lobby a scene where fine suddenly
decides to flee from inquisitive police
is followed by a brilliant beat before
the pursuit Begins the entire script is
filled with these fun little moments
with the picture book ended by Wilkinson
providing some introductory narration
remarking the incidents that follow were
described to me exactly as I present
them here and in a wholly unexpected way
the light and Whimsical score from
Alexander despla is a perfect fit for
the zany somewhat unbelievable events
that unfold on screen even incorporating
a rare Russian string instrument during
the T ski slope sequence I often use the
word formulaic as a criticism of modern
Cinema but perhaps the highest
compliment I can give this picture is
how truly original and un formulaic
Everything feels repeat viewings are
almost required to catch all of the many
intricacies and cross references in a
story that flies by too fast to really
soak it all in the Grand Budapest Hotel
is a goofy time with layers of
personality and here's what you had to
say about it in the YouTube comments
awarding this to top score you
especially love the writing and ensemble
cast there was a certain intangible
depth missing from this picture that's
making me hold back so I'll give this a
9 out of 10
[Applause]
[Music]
